metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5187 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.85 for Android incorrectly handled rapid transition into and out of full screen mode, which allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox (URL bar) via crafted HTML pages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> This looks like it's in the TopControlsManager, used only in Chrome/Android. Oxide also makes use of this functionality

criterions.comment: oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
